column4: i am doing fsck, its finding lots of bad inodes what ever those are
i am jsut pressing yes to fix all
but, why did it break the inodeS?..all i did was use rt kernal
could shutting the laptop pwoer off with the power button break inodes?
let me go back and read your posts a sec...
i read your ubuntufourms post, if you install a bunch of extra kernel stuff it could possibly go over 10gb...
you can try creating a gparted disk, boot to that and adjust your partitions
/tmp is part of /, so if / is full there's no room to write to /tmp
i'd use gparted to decrease /home by 10 or 15gb and add that to /
logfilename.1 - usually a rotated log file, probably done once per week
